Package bhs.devilbotz.subsystems

Class DriveTrain

java.lang.Object
edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
bhs.devilbotz.subsystems.DriveTrain
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
public class DriveTrain extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
The DriveTrain subsystem controls the robot's drive train. It also handles: - The NAVX (gyroscope) - The odometry (position tracking) - The kinematics (wheel speeds)
Since:
1/30/2023
See Also:
  • Kinematics and Odometry

    • resetOdometry

      public void resetOdometry(edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d pose)
      Resets the odometry to the specified pose.
      Parameters:
      pose - The pose to which to set the odometry.

    • resetRobotPosition

      public void resetRobotPosition()
      Resets the robot position to pose specified in network tables. Allows a user to choose robot starting position by entering x, y, and rotation values via Shuffleboard or Smartdashboard. User must toggle boolean to true to read from network tables. Otherwise the last position of robot on field is used. A user can also enable Test mode and drag/drop robot around field to any position.

    • simulationPeriodic

      public void simulationPeriodic()

    • followTrajectoryCommand

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command followTrajectoryCommand(com.pathplanner.lib.PathPlannerTrajectory traj, boolean isFirstPath)
      Uses ramsete controller to follow the specified trajectory
      Parameters:
      traj - Requested trajectory
      isFirstPath - Set to true if this is the first path being run in autonomous in order to reset odometry before starting
      Returns:
      A sequential command that when executed, moves the robot along the specified trajectory
      See Also:
      • PathPlanner Example
